intro: Hieracium pullatum, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium pullatum is often considered a weed due to its rapid spread and ability to thrive in various environments.
